Reviews.Title: “A big mistake”
Reviews.Author: Rahulismyname
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Rome as a Solo traveler during March 2012, believed to be an off-peak period. Since season starts around Easter. I made a reservation well in advance for 4 days on their website for a price, I would have been easily been able to get a 3 star in the same neighborhood or a 4 star a little far. My reasons of booking this place: - Good reviews on Tripadvisor, usually Tripadvisor has helped me pick the best hotel all the time with reviews from user, however this time not sure what happened. The place turned out to be useless based on the kind of reviews found on the website. - Distance from Termini, YES! this hotel is located around 200-300 meters from Termini station, whereas there are many (actually too many) other hotels in the same neighborhood which are byfar lot better than this place. - Both the receptionist (one in morning, other in evening) don't speak or understand English at all. It was nightmare communicating with them. - Wireless connection has charges 5 Euros per day and you'll have to come down to the reception area in order to access it, so you cannot actually access it from your room, since there was no network on third floor, not sure if that was the case with other floors too, however that is what the receptionist told me. - Complimentary Breakfast: I don't know what to say, all I can say is there's nothing for free and its nothing special here too and no buffet don't get excited when you see that word. Rest of the things about elevator, etc. has already been mentioned by other people. I would highly recommend not staying at this hotel please, since you have lot of other better options.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, plus breakfast in bed!”
Reviews.Author: DavidandBrigid C
Reviews.Content: Great hotel near the train station. The hotel is old (everything in Rome is old!), but really comfortable and a friendly staff. They opened a bottle of wine for us when we forgot our corkscrew. The shower was clean and had really good water pressure. It's on the small side, so if you're overweight, you will have to wriggle through the doors. The internet is an extra 5euros/day, but worked well. And breakfast! It's delivered to your room every morning at a time of your choosing (between 7-9) ... not big, just a croissant and a drink of your choosing. We had two croissants, a cappuccino, and an orange juice delivered at 8am every day (for the two of us). I never thought I'd have breakfast in bed at a budget hotel, but it was great. We stayed on the 1st floor (2nd US), so with the windows open it's a bit noisy. But the hotel is equipped with soundproofing windows when they are closed. With the blackout shades, we could have slept 14 hours if there weren't so many nearby sights to see. Overall, excellent value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent three nights at the Touring . We came in off the street ,had nothing booked and took the large one bedroom apartment with living room , kitchen & bath for 100 Euros. We thought it was a great deal as our friends were across the street paying 175 for a tiny little double room! The apartment was very clean and the staff friendly. It's true they don't speak a lot of English but did use a computer translator to answer our questions. The location is great ..a 5 min walk to the train station(a metro stop is also there) and all the main sites within an easy walk. We would certainly go back again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “apartment at Touring”
Reviews.Author: Megan M
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the apartments at Touring with my mom. I did not find apartments as an option on the major travel booking sites, but you can book it on their own web site. It was a spacious apartment with a large bedroom (we asked for two single beds), a living room area with dinning table, spacious bathroom, and kitchen area. It was nice to have a refrigerator during our stay. They brought breakfast to us at the time we asked and it consisted of the type of coffee you want (cappuccino, espresso, americano etc...) and a croissant and cookie things. It was so nice to wake up to a fresh cappuccino arriving at your door. We had air conditioning that worked great. The staff was very helpful. We enjoyed our stay at Touring.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: yariq
Reviews.Content: Awful hotel. It’s old, rooms are tiny, staff speaks english only a little, and some of them doesn’t seem to speak english at all. And all of them can forget english if then want - when I wanted to pay my stay with credit card on check-out, I’ve been told, that they had “problems” with it. And a woman on reception suddenly stopped to understand english. So I had to pay in cash and spend almost all of my money. So-called “breakfast” is a small cap of moderate coffee with a croissant and two tiny biscuits. This breakfast is very poor even for Rome, so the first thing we did after this “breakfast” was a visit of a nearest cafe or McDonalds. As I already said our room was very small, there were no enough space even for our bags. Of course there wasn’t safe box in room, but it was possible to leave values on reception desk. There wasn’t air-conditioner in the room and a fan was almost broken, so I had to fix it first before using. Bathroom was very old with some strange equipment for saving water, so it was almost impossible to use toilet if nobody was in shower before it. And a shower cubicle looked like it was elder than me. Location is great, there is subway station near the hotel and It’s close enough to railway station. Some attractions are close to hotel and you can easily reach many of famous places on foot. But the street in which hotel is situated is VERY noisy. From early morning and till late night you can hear great noise from number of restaurants, music, sounds of cars and motors. And it’s impossible to close windows because of absence of air-conditioner, so you’ll be slipping into oven. The only good thing about this hotel is it’s price, so you could choose it if you don’t want to spend a lot of money, but only if you’re going to Rome in winter. I strongly recommend to avoid this hotel in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marco_aragno
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent! – friendly and helpful staff, nice rooms and awesome location! We will definetely return soon. Thank you for making our holiday a great one!

Reviews.Title: “Low cost = Low Returns!”
Reviews.Author: tboyce32
Reviews.Content: Had a very unenjoyable experience with a particular staff member in which he was yelling and not accomodating at all. Within the first 10 minutes I saw a bug crawling on the floor. The only reason I would recommend this hotel is if you are on a tight budget and are willing to rough it a bit. Location was great, but my stay would have been much more comfortable elsewhere...like laying in the street! Most staff members did not speak English so I continually went across the street to another hotel to ask questions.

Reviews.Title: “been robbed”
Reviews.Author: ratomat
Reviews.Content: my room 31. For the first day in Roma, was perfect, good location, fare value. but in the second day i made a mistake, i let 250€ in a book in the room. When i went back later before dinner, the room had been cleaned, but the money was not in the same sheet of the book, and missing 50€. Of course they do not respond for what we let there, but i was completely sure about the quantity and how i let it there. I ask for answers in the reception and of course they could do nothing. Only that who cleaned the room was a woman called Nicoletta, they don´t even know the last name. They called her and she said that saw nothing. my fault. word against word. i'll never go back near this hotel or let them to clean my room.

Reviews.Title: “Budget wise, it's good”
Reviews.Author: dmed
Reviews.Content: This really is a 2 star hotel. What can make this worth it is the price, being so low at a good location very near the train terminal. Staff was kind, didn't go out of their way but did do what they had to. Although I've read bad reviews here, nothing was strikingly bad. Breakfast is very minimal and not that good. But room is very spacious, bathroom was ok although the shower is a bit small! Note: Street is noisy, walls arent very thick and anytime someone leaves or enters their room, you cannot miss it. Also, double beds don't seem to exist, they put 2 single beds together so be carefull not to fall in between! If what you're looking for is low budget but good, this place fits. It's all about location and pricing with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel if you can stand bedbugs and other insects.”
Reviews.Author: permafunk
Reviews.Content: first of all, i understand this is a budget hotel and that for the price, one cannot expect much. however, bedbugs and insects all over the room are something that i cannot tolerate no matter how cheap the room is.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: NotMuchOfATraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice inexpensive hotel, at a great central location (very close to Termini, also 20 minutes walking from Colloseum and Spanish steps and other Rome features). Very basic, almost no features (does offer cheap wireless Internet access), including no proper breakfast but that obviously to keep price low. But who goes to Rome to sit in a hotel room... Only downside for me was no airco, as others have mentioned the street is noisy (busy street), that would not be a problem if you could keep window closed but you cannot do that without airco in July and August.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic but good location”
Reviews.Author: Sonja29
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located five minutes from Termini station and basically a walking distance from major tourist attractions. This unfortunatelly means a lo-ot of noise at night, so light sleepers might not like it. The staff is helpful. Breakfast means a plastic cup of coffee and a croissant, so don't be expecting a feast, but the coffee's good and the croissant's fresh. Rooms are very basic but the hotel feels rather clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly good !”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Zlin
Reviews.Content: I didn´t expected too much for 2 stars, but this 2 block away place from Termini, for 160,- Euro family room (2 nights) was more then sufficient. Kind people in 24h reception, lift and no "one person" staircase, fair breakfast delivered to room (you can choose time, tea or coffee, bakery). Baggage after check-out without problem... I´ve seen many worse places for much higher price !

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Touring
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Via Principe Amedeo, 00185 Rome, Italy
